activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa S. Lawrence

records.addlTxt:
2:38 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Melissa S. Lawrence in court. 
Back on record - 
Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Information now filed, In receipt, defendant still wishes to plead no contest.
Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists but will defer judgment and accept the DEJ.  Court statement to defendant. 
Bail continued.
Further questions by defendant.  Court statement.

2:20 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Melissa S. Lawrence in court. 
Schiek statement to agreement.  DEJ filed.  No contest plea.  Court statement to felony plea,  no waiver, no information.  Schiek statement - 
Court will recess and recall after 2:15 hearing.  
  .
Bail continued
Review hearing scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

3:10 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Melissa S. Lawrence in court. Court review of case. Defendant waives right to counsel - waiver free and voluntary. Court directs Defendant to make appointment with DA's office. Defendant states spoke with ADA - has agreement. Set for preliminary hearing. Bail continued. Bond continued. adj. 03:15 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
